story: Once upon a time, there was a big orange steer named Bevo. He lived at a school called UT. Every day, Bevo would walk around the green grass and watch the students play. The students loved Bevo. They would come and pet his soft fur. Bevo was very happy at UT. He knew this was his home.

One day, a little girl named Lily came to see Bevo. She wore an orange shirt. 'Hook 'em Horns!' she said to Bevo. Bevo swished his tail and made a soft sound. Lily smiled big. 'You are my favorite,' she told Bevo. She gave him some hay to eat. Bevo ate the hay and felt happy. Lily and Bevo became best friends.

It was game day at UT. Bevo heard loud music playing. He saw many people wearing orange clothes. They were all very happy. 'Today is a big day,' said a man to Bevo. Bevo walked onto the big field. All the people cheered very loud. Bevo felt proud. He liked making people happy.

Bevo had a friend. His friend was a very tall tower. The tower could see far away. 'Hello, Tower,' said Bevo. 'Hello, Bevo,' said the Tower. 'I can see all of UT from up here.' Bevo said, 'I am strong and I have big horns.' The Tower said, 'We are both special.' They were the best of friends.

The sun was very hot in Texas. Bevo was too warm. He wanted to cool down. Bevo found a big tree with lots of shade. He walked under the tree and lay down in the soft grass. A little bird sang a pretty song. Bevo closed his eyes. He felt much better. The shade was nice.

Sara was a new student. She did not know anyone. She felt scared. Then she saw Bevo. 'Hi, Bevo,' said Sara in a small voice. Bevo looked at her with kind, gentle eyes. Sara petted Bevo's soft nose. Bevo made a happy sound. Sara smiled. 'I think I will like it here,' she said. Now Sara felt brave.

Bevo loved the color orange. It was everywhere at UT. The students wore orange. The flags were orange. The building was orange. Even the flowers were orange. Bevo swished his tail back and forth. Orange made him very happy. 'This is my favorite color,' Bevo thought.

Early one morning, Bevo woke up. The sun was just coming up. The campus was very quiet. Bevo walked slowly on the paths. He saw the pretty buildings. He saw the green trees. 'UT is beautiful,' thought Bevo. He loved his home very much. This was the best place to live.

The band started to play. Bevo heard the drums. Boom, boom, boom! The students marched in lines. They wore orange and white clothes. Bevo walked with the band. Left, right, left, right. The people clapped and cheered. 'This is so fun!' thought Bevo. Music made him happy.

Jack wanted to take a picture with Bevo. He felt nervous. 'What if Bevo does not like me?' Jack asked his dad. His dad said, 'Bevo is very nice. Do not worry.' Jack walked to Bevo. Bevo stood very still. Jack smiled big. Click! They took the picture. 'Thank you, Bevo!' said Jack.

It started to rain. Bevo stood in his pen. The rain felt cool and nice. Puddles formed on the ground. Bevo stepped in a puddle. Splash! Water went everywhere. Bevo made a happy sound. 'I like rain!' thought Bevo. Playing in puddles was fun.

Bevo saw a squirrel. The squirrel had a big fluffy tail. 'Hello, little friend,' said Bevo. The squirrel looked at Bevo. Then the squirrel ran up a tree very fast. Bevo waited. The squirrel came back down. It ate a nut near Bevo. They sat together quietly. It was nice to have a friend.

Every night, Bevo looked up at the sky. The stars were very bright in Texas. They twinkled like little lights. Bevo made a wish. 'I wish for UT to always be happy,' he said. The stars seemed to shine brighter. Bevo felt good inside. Wishes were important.

The football team came to see Bevo. They wore their special uniforms. 'We will win today!' they said. Bevo nodded his big head up and down. The players petted Bevo's soft fur. 'You give us good luck, Bevo,' said the coach. Bevo felt very proud to help his team.

Bevo found a small yellow flower. It was growing near his pen. He sniffed the flower. It smelled very good. Bevo was careful not to step on it. Every day, Bevo looked at his flower. He watched it grow. 'You are my flower friend,' Bevo thought. He took good care of it.

Once there was a baby longhorn. His name was Little Bevo. He was small and learning. Big Bevo helped him. 'One day you will be big and strong,' said Bevo. Little Bevo smiled. 'Will I be like you?' he asked. 'Yes,' said Bevo. 'You will be great.' Little Bevo felt happy.

Students sat on the grass. They were reading books. Bevo walked by them. A girl read her book out loud. The story was about a brave steer. Bevo stopped to listen. 'That steer is just like you, Bevo!' said the girl. Bevo felt proud. He liked stories about steers.

Bevo had very long horns. They curved up and out. He was proud of his horns. Students made a sign with their hands. 'Hook 'em Horns!' they shouted. Bevo knew this sign meant they loved him. He swished his tail happily. It felt good to be loved.

It was Bevo's birthday! The students brought him treats. There were apples and carrots and hay. Bevo ate everything. It was all very yummy. The students sang, 'Happy birthday, Bevo!' Bevo made happy sounds. This was the best day ever. He loved birthdays.

A small bird built a nest near Bevo. The bird was blue and pretty. She laid three eggs in the nest. Bevo watched over the nest. He made sure nothing hurt the bird. One day, baby birds hatched! Bevo was so happy. 'Welcome, little birds,' he said. He was a good protector.

At night, the Tower lit up. It glowed bright orange. Bevo saw the pretty light. 'The Tower looks beautiful,' thought Bevo. The orange light meant UT had won the game! Everyone was so happy. Bevo made a loud moo sound. The people cheered. It was a great day.

Bevo walked to the fountain. Water splashed up and down. It was a hot day. Bevo put his nose in the water. The water was cold and felt good. He drank some water. Then he stood by the fountain. The cool water made him feel better. He liked the fountain.

Two kids were lost. They could not find their mom. They looked scared. 'We are lost,' said the little boy. Bevo saw them. He walked over slowly. 'Follow me,' Bevo seemed to say. The kids followed Bevo. He led them to the big building. Their mom was there! 'Thank you, Bevo!' they said.

It was fall time. The leaves changed colors. Some were red. Some were gold. Bevo walked through the leaves. Crunch, crunch, crunch! The leaves made fun sounds. Bevo liked fall. The weather was cool. The leaves were pretty. 'Fall is nice,' thought Bevo.

An artist came to UT. She wanted to draw Bevo. 'Please stand still, Bevo,' she asked. Bevo stood very still. The artist drew his horns and his face and his body. When she finished, she showed Bevo. 'That's me!' thought Bevo. He felt special. The picture was very good.

One night, Bevo had a dream. In the dream, he could fly! He flew over the UT campus. He saw everything from up high. The buildings looked small. The students waved at him. When Bevo woke up, he felt happy. 'That was a good dream,' he thought. Dreams were fun.

The cheerleaders practiced near Bevo. They jumped very high. They did flips in the air. 'Go Longhorns!' they shouted. Bevo watched them. They were very good. The cheerleaders came over. They petted Bevo. 'You're our good luck charm!' they said. Bevo felt proud. He liked helping the team.

A butterfly landed on Bevo's horn. It was orange and black. Bevo stayed very still. He did not want to scare the butterfly. The butterfly sat on his horn. Its wings moved up and down. 'Hello, little friend,' whispered Bevo. The butterfly flew away. Bevo smiled. Nature was beautiful.

Tim was afraid of big animals. He saw Bevo and felt scared. His teacher said, 'Bevo is very nice. He will not hurt you.' Tim walked closer. Bevo made a soft, gentle sound. Tim touched Bevo's soft fur. 'You are nice!' said Tim. He was not afraid anymore. Bevo made Tim feel brave.

The grass at UT was very green. Bevo loved to eat the grass. It tasted good. Every day, Bevo ate grass. 'This is yummy,' thought Bevo. The grass kept him strong. The grass kept him healthy. Eating grass made Bevo happy. He liked living at UT.
